Package words

Class Stanza

  • java.lang.Object
    • words.Stanza
  • public class Stanza
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encodes a stanza as a collection of lines, a desired rhyming scheme, and an intended rhyme scheme.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Stanza​(int startLine)  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addLine​(java.lang.String line)
      Breaks a string into tokens (either words or whitespace, punctuation etc.) and adds the collection of tokens to the stanza as a line.
      void evaluateRhymingScheme()
      Determines the current rhyming scheme of the poem, using perfect rhyme.
      RhymeScheme getActualRhymeScheme()  
      RhymeScheme getDesiredRhymeScheme()  
      java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Token>> getLines()  
      int getStartLine()  
      boolean joinWords​(int lineIndex, int tokenIndex1, int tokenIndex2)
      Joins two adjacent words into one, to allow users to make use of WordsAPI's entries for short phrases.
      int lineCount()  
      boolean setDesiredRhymeScheme​(java.lang.String rhymeScheme)
      Overwrites current desired rhyme scheme.
      boolean setDesiredRhymeSchemeFromDefault​(RhymeScheme rhymeScheme)
      Avoids overwriting prior intended rhyme scheme.
      boolean splitWord​(int lineIndex, int tokenIndex, java.lang.String separator)
      Separates one word into two adjacent words, to allow users to get around WordsAPI's entries for short phrases.
      void substituteWord​(int lineIndex, int tokenIndex, SuperWord newWord)
      Replaces a word.
      java.lang.String toString()

      • setDesiredRhymeScheme

        public boolean setDesiredRhymeScheme​(java.lang.String rhymeScheme)
        Overwrites current desired rhyme scheme. Nullifies desired rhyme scheme if passed empty string.
        Parameters:
        rhymeScheme - new rhyme scheme.
        Returns:
        true if successful update.

      • setDesiredRhymeSchemeFromDefault

        public boolean setDesiredRhymeSchemeFromDefault​(RhymeScheme rhymeScheme)
        Avoids overwriting prior intended rhyme scheme.
        Parameters:
        rhymeScheme - the poem's default rhyme scheme.
        Returns:
        true if change occured.

      • substituteWord

        public void substituteWord​(int lineIndex,
                           int tokenIndex,
                           SuperWord newWord)
        Replaces a word.
        Parameters:
        lineIndex - which line the word is in.
        tokenIndex - the token index of the word (including non-word tokens).
        newWord - the replacement word.

      • joinWords

        public boolean joinWords​(int lineIndex,
                         int tokenIndex1,
                         int tokenIndex2)
        Joins two adjacent words into one, to allow users to make use of WordsAPI's entries for short phrases. Updates the actual rhyme scheme if this affects the last word of the line.
        Parameters:
        lineIndex - which line the words are in.
        tokenIndex1 - the token index of one word (including non-word tokens).
        tokenIndex2 - the token index of the other word (including non-word tokens).
        Returns:
        true if a substitution was made.

      • splitWord

        public boolean splitWord​(int lineIndex,
                         int tokenIndex,
                         java.lang.String separator)
        Separates one word into two adjacent words, to allow users to get around WordsAPI's entries for short phrases. Updates the actual rhyme scheme if this affects the last word of the line.
        Parameters:
        lineIndex - which line the word is in.
        tokenIndex - the token index of the word (including non-word tokens).
        separator - the separator string (typically "-" or " ").
        Returns:
        true if a substitution was made.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • evaluateRhymingScheme

        public void evaluateRhymingScheme()
        Determines the current rhyming scheme of the poem, using perfect rhyme.
